intro: Columnea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy flame plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its vibrant floral display. Columnea hirsuta prefers well-drained soil and consistent moisture, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
